Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as a6d4e65d5c4c78f86d690fff31b79db9fa8c3b4c
There are a few concerns with consistency in error messages and event names that should be addressed.

Currently a dependency patch for this change is submitted.
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/52897
It is regarding adding a new debug host selector button dbus interface. 
we need to decide and finalise the dbus interface format.
Naveen...is there an ETA on when the next patchset which resolves the build verification failure and resolves the comments will be available?

I have resolved the review comments, rebased and fixed the merge conflicts
This patch depends on the following patch:
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/52897
Since Pressed is changed to Released in other functions, should this one change as well?
As mentioned later in this file, log message capitalization should be consistent.
Need consistency in error messages.  In this one, "Host and Selector" are capitalized.  In line 419, Host is capitalized and selector is not and in line 432 none of them are capitalized.
Few minor naming and standards issues I would like to see corrected.  Rest of patch looks good.  Thanks!
Also, see the verification failed so that needs to be addressed as well.
It would be good to keep the function name standard already present as indicated in line 115 and not abbreviate HostSelector as HS in this function and again in the function name in line 123.
Please reformat to keep within the 80 char line limit standard.
Please modify function name to indicate HostSelector instead of "HS"
You can just use a single 'GetAll' call here instead since they're both on the same interface.
A couple of questions about the updated patchset.
Removing the +1 until comments are resolved.

Why are you changing these names?

If I look at power_button.cpp, it is emiting the pressed signal on a press, not a release...

ok, i see in handler::handler it is watching the Released signal.


Would it be possible to move these renames to a separate commit?
Maybe rebase this commit on top of your new one?
If you find MaxPosition (or Position below) should you break out of the for loop to help performance?
we are getting all properties associated with HostSelector interface. So we are only reading 2 properties.
Is it an error condition if the name isn't MaxPosition or 'Position'?  If so, an else clause should be added to handle it.

these two are the properties we need.there wont be any other property name under HostSelector interface.even in case of any other property, ignoring it is fine. no need to report error. Error in case of reading the properties Position or MaxPosition will be handled in the try catch exception block.
I don't think this is used in this file?

while I can't think of a reason that MaxPosition or Position wouldn't be returned in the GetAll call, if they weren't there you'd end up operating on uninitialized variables on lines 407/408 and wouldn't know it.

Maybe just access them directly so you'll at least crash if they aren't there?
